div.div:
Organization: Archive Team
Formed in 2009, the Archive Team (not to be confused with the archive.org Archive-It Team) is a rogue archivist collective dedicated to saving copies of rapidly dying or deleted websites for the sake of history and digital heritage. The group is 100% composed of volunteers and interested parties, and has expanded into a large amount of related projects for saving online and digital history.
History is littered with hundreds of conflicts over the future of a community, group, location or business that were "resolved" when one of the parties stepped ahead and destroyed what was there. With the original point of contention destroyed, the debates would fall to the wayside. Archive Team believes that by duplicated condemned data, the conversation and debate can continue, as well as the richness and insight gained by keeping the materials. Our projects have ranged in size from a single volunteer downloading the data to a small-but-critical site, to over 100 volunteers stepping forward to acquire terabytes of user-created data to save for future generations.
The main site for Archive Team is at archiveteam.org and contains up to the date information on various projects, manifestos, plans and walkthroughs.
This collection contains the output of many Archive Team projects, both ongoing and completed. Thanks to the generous providing of disk space by the Internet Archive, multi-terabyte datasets can be made available, as well as in use by the Wayback Machine, providing a path back to lost websites and work.
Our collection has grown to the point of having sub-collections for the type of data we acquire. If you are seeking to browse the contents of these collections, the Wayback Machine is the best first stop. Otherwise, you are free to dig into the stacks to see what you may find.
The Archive Team Panic Downloads are full pulldowns of currently extant websites, meant to serve as emergency backups for needed sites that are in danger of closing, or which will be missed dearly if suddenly lost due to hard drive crashes or server failures.
Collection: Archive Team: Wiki Wiki Wiki
A collection of various Wikis throughout the internet, gathered as a last resting spot.

string.original: Select the friends you would like to request this part from:
Do you have more pending requests to answer?
Please remember to answer each request right away.
Not so fast, Commander. The Intelligence Report isn't available for this battle yet. Please, select an active battle.
Apologies, Commander. There is a prerequisite mission to complete first before we can advance to this battle. Please, select an active battle.
Commander, we cannot risk proceeding until we complete the '{task}' task!
Commander, we cannot risk proceeding until we complete these tasks: {tasks}!
Commander, reports indicate that our forces are already engaged in another battle. You must first complete the battle-in-progress. Resume the battle?
Commander, you've already won this battle. You can strike again, but older missions will earn you fewer rewards.
You destroyed the enemy Tank and have secured the home island... for now.
All right! You really put the crunch on the Captain!
You left Captain Krunsch crying in his cereal!
Enjoy this one, you clownfish. The Captain's just gettin' warmed up!
Nice shooting, Commander! You sank his battleship!
Good news on Cape Pleasant! Cows are back to work on their dairy farms.
That the best you got? I seen more fight from a flounder!
Way to go, Commander! His navy belongs in a bathtub.
That win was so full of awesome I can't wait for the encore!
Pipe down, you jellyfish! Couple lousy victories don't make you an Admiral.
Fish for dinner on Cape Pleasant! They're back in charge of their beaches!
With shooting like that the Captain's going to need more lifeboats!
You think I'm all washed up? Think again, you miserable carp!
Krunsch's battleship has been spotted approaching.
I don't care if my army's down the drain. You're still a spineless squid in my book!
A temporary setback. Just wait and see what I have prepared for you next!
She's going to be bowing to us after a few more victories like that.
Way to go, Commander! Kai Tana's troops are running scared now.
You have passed my test so far, Commander. You shall be a worthy servant.
Excellent! We liberated one of the weapon depots!
I could say Kai Tana fought valiantly... but that would be a lie.
We've secured another island and broken Kai Tana's blade!
I will fillet your defenses next time, Commander!
That's the spirit! You carved up Kai Tana's troops like a lobster roll.
I'm starting to get angry. You won't like me when I'm angry.
Nice shooting! Kai Tana's comrades are pushing up water lilies.
Next time I will make teriyaki of your rotten army!
Bravo, Commander! That victory should be hanging in the Louvre.
Yes! Kai Tana's wardrobe is in tatters and another island is ours.
Obviously, chivalry is dead - get ready to join it, Commander!
Go back to your little island where it is safe and warm.
Kai Tana's troops went Kai Boom!
Nice work, Commander! Kai Tana's planes are Kai-put!
That defeat was shameful. How will I ever tell The Raven?
Careful, Commander! You've got a tiger by the tail this time.
So you're the new Commander I heard about. I am NOT impressed!
You think you can just waltz in here and take me down that easily? Well you can't.
You did it! Jada's troops were expertly disarmed.
Good work! Reef Haven has recovered enough oil to power their generators!
Don't get cocky! I'm just about to get serious!
Beware, Commander: you're really playing with fire now.
They don't call me "Bombs" for nothin'. Stand still and I'll explain!
Jada keeps talking trash, but she's all bark and no bomb.
Bravo, Commander! You totally defused Jada's bombers.
Sorry Commander, I'm not leaving yet. I've got more pillaging to do!
Blast! You made me break a nail. That's gonna cost you!
Good news! Reef Haven is back in business and mounting a resistance.
Way to go, Commander! Jada's troops are starting to fizzle.
That battle meant nothing to me! Less than nothing! I spit on it! Ptah!
Now Jada Bombs is under attack from two sides - us and Reef Haven!
Way to go, Commander! Jada's planes are dropping like flies!
I have to admit, I didn't think a scrawny pest like you could hold up this long.
Keep it up, Commander! Jada's plans are about to go up in smoke!
I'm not going to keep warning you, Commander. Back off!
When The Raven gets wind of this I'm gonna have a hot mess on my hands. I'm outa here!
Lucky shot! Now I shall become my alter-ego, Baron Crush-a-lot!
Avenge the people of Teramar - show this airhead no mercy!
Nice shooting! The Baron's planes will have to make unscheduled layovers!
You think you're winning... but... well, maybe you are. But you won't!
Nice moves, Commander - you're flying circles around the Baron!
Sticks and stones may break my bones... Good thing you've only got bullets and bombs!
I soar like an eagle, but I feel like a sitting duck!
We own the sky, Commander! This whack-job is merely borrowing it.
I am going to crash your victory party and eat all your hors d'oeuvres!
Good news! People on Teramar are escaping the work camps.
Ha! Even in defeat I am still a Baron and you are not!
If he really is a Baron, that victory is a royal flush!
More wins like that and the people of Teramar will be home for dinner!
Rescue Teramar? Over my dead body... No, wait! Over your dead body!
Sweet shooting! The Baron's forces look like Swiss cheese!
A meaningless victory! My repairs shall cost only a few groats. We still use groats, don't we?
You smacked the Baron so bad, his kids will be born dizzy.
You did it! The people of Teramar have reclaimed their ore mines.
Curses! Not only did I lose, but my pilot's license has expired!
Bravo, Commander! The Baron's air force is in a tailspin!
Teramar will be free soon - thanks to your new tanks!
You will never liquidate Teramar! Oh wait... you said "liberate." My bad.
Congratulations! The Baron's frequent-flyer miles will soon be worthless!
Thanks to you I've now crashed 117 times! And those are just the ones I remember...
Turn it up a notch, Commander! It's time to ground this flyboy for good!
A good pilot goes down with his plane, especially when the "eject" button's broken.
Brilliant, Commander - you've clipped the Baron's wings!
Excellent work, Commander! The Baron is in a freefall!
So you shot me down. I'm an expert crasher - wait, where's my paaaraaachuuuuute!?!
Winning ain't everything. But it sure beats losing!
Nice job, Commander! You really put those girls in time out.
They clear-cut Isla Azul's forests, so I say we cut their allowance.
Oh! My! God! That was so unfair!
Let's settle this like ladies: Us against Scarlett...cage match!
That should teach those twins a lesson! Two aren't always better than one!
Excellent! You helped some islanders escape from the Isla Azul camps!
Watching you go down in flames would be, like, soooo hot!
We'll have to bring out the big guns to beat the Graves Girls again!
Bravo, Commander. That should teach those girls some manners!
Losing to you sucks, like, worse than Charm School!
You're proud of that victory? Really? You're so lame!
Nice victory, Commander! Double the pleasure, double the fun!
I'll bet the only thing those girls hate more than losing is wearing plaid.
Wow! You're, like, serious about this, aren't you?
Hurray! The last prisoners on Isla Azul have escaped from the Dark Alliance camps!
Nothing says we hate you like a missile through your heart!
Beware, Commander: Those girls have made a voodoo doll of you!
We're so awesome! Aren't we, like, your favorite enemies ever?
Good news! You've destroyed another Dark Alliance prison camp!
Two Graves masterplans for the price of one! It's a double plot - get it?
Time to step it up, Commander! The girls' troops are vulnerable.
Well played! Always nice to see bad girls get what they deserve.
Hurry up and die! We have matching black outfits picked out for your funeral!
You're gonna so regret this for, like... totally forever!
One victory does not make you an opponent worthy of my genius.
Beware: the only thing bigger than Von Helman's army is his ego.
This is impossible! I am smarter than you and your entire army combined!
Bravo, Commander! That was quite the smack down!
That's it, Commander! You're pulling Lobster Bay out of the boiling water!
You really taught the Professor a lesson with that one, Commander!
In the dictionary under "domination" there is a dashing picture of yours truly.
Well done! You're making the Professor look like a first grader!
Good news! We cut off the Dark Alliance's supply lines.
You think you won, but you are merely walking into my ingenious trap!
The Professor thinks he's smart but you just made him look stupid!
Nice shooting! You really put some lead in Von Helman's Zeppelin!
Surrender now! Your odds of another victory like that are miniscule.
Keep this up and we'll deep six Von Helman's depot in no time!
The Professor's going to have to study a lot harder to defeat you!
Do you have any idea what my I.Q. is? I truly doubt you can even count that high!
I only lost because your tiresome battle strategy put me to sleep.
Good news! We've broken through Von Helman's depot defenses.
Way to go! I'd give that victory over the Professor an A+!
Of course you won. I was only using only one-half of my brainpower!
Ha! You fell for the oldest trick in the book: "Playing Possum."
What a victory, Commander! School is definitely out for the Professor.
Enjoy it while it lasts, Commander. Victory is temporary; genius is forever!
You will need a tutor to comprehend the masterful assault I have planned next.
Let's step it up! The Professor's forces can't even spell "victory" anymore!
Good work, Commander! The Professor's tenure is about to end!
Time for me to show you how I earned my PhD in Destruction!
Great news! The Professor's supply depot is about to fall!
It seems I must alter my equation for complete annihilation...
Keep going! We've almost got this so-called genius in checkmate.
Savor that victory like a last meal, Commander. There will not be another.
Well played! You've destroyed the Professor's supply depot.
It does not take a genius to know The Raven will be furious with my defeat.
Hurray! Let's sing a dirge for the Professor's dirigible!
I'm actually glad you won. It will make your inevitable defeat by The Raven all the more humiliating.
Big whoop. You beat a one-armed blind man.
Good work, Commander! That was lights out for that "Mole Man."
Nice shooting! Mollman's forces suffered debilitating damage!
If I had a bazooka on my other arm you never would've won that one!
I must hand it to you, Commander, you really stuck it to Mollman that time!
Way to go! You bored a gaping hole in Mollman's defenses.
Next time I'm gonna drill you where the sun don't shine!
Well played! Mollman needs a more penetrating plan to beat you.
Good news! We secured an underground base on Pacificor with that win!
I guess you could say I'm really digging a hole for myself now...
So much for the "Mole Man!" His forces are reeling - it's the blind leading the blind!
Excellent! You really put the screws on Mollman that time.
Hmm... looks like my famous "Killer Driller" move is a bit rusty.
Great news! The Dark Alliance headquarters is now under attack!
Fantastic! Dirk Mollman's forces are leaking like a sieve!
I just realized "The bigger they are, the harder they fall" is painfully true.
Bravo! We broke through the Dark Alliance defenses on Pacificor.
Keep going! Digger is about ready to crawl back into his hole.
Try that again! I'll beat you with one corkscrew tied behind my back!
Well done! You found the chink in Digger's armor-plated arm!
That really hurt! I may look like a freak, but I'm a freak with feelings.
It will take awhile for Dirk's forces to dig themselves out of that one!
Hurray! The Dark Alliance headquarters on Pacificor is destroyed!
What can I say? After that defeat I'm totally screwed...
If I go back to The Raven I'm just digging my own grave...
That was your best shot? Prepare yourself for my injection of agony!
Nice shooting! Nurse Malady's the sickness and you're the cure!
The lights will be back on in Port Sylvan in no time thanks to you!
I will giggle over your grave, Commander. Laughter's the best medicine!
Malady is nursing her wounds after that victory, Commander!
Way to go, Commander! That defeat's a bitter pill for Malady to swallow.
Next time you'll see why I failed my "bedside manner" test!
Bravo! Our Panzers just turned Malady from a nurse into a patient!
The first rule of medicine is "Do no harm" - time to break the rules!
All your naval victories over Malady are turning her into a wet nurse!
Now it's my turn, Commander. An assault a day keeps the doctor away!
That's giving Nurse Malady a taste of her own bad medicine!
Good work, Commander! Malady's forces are the walking wounded.
Drop your Panzers and prepare for an attack from the rear!
There's no way Malady's insurance covers her injuries from that battle!
Malady will have to stitch together her forces after that victory!
Your blunt approach has worked so far, but just wait for my surgical strikes!
You made Nurse Malady look like a Candy Striper out there!
There's only one way to heal my bruised ego: annihilating yours!
Your patience has turned Nurse Malady's troops into patients!
Well played! Malady's forces are in critical condition now.
I may be on life support, but I'm about to pull the plug on you!
Congratulations, Commander! The power is back on in Port Sylvan.
I think Nurse Malady is going to fail her check-up, Commander!
Just the thought of informing The Raven of my defeat is making me ill...
The only remedy for defeat is a serious dose of vengeance.
Nice shooting! Let's send LeChomp's forces back to The Bayou!
Bravo, Commander! LeChomp is a curse on Tranquility Cove!
This may look easy, but LeChomp's still got a big bite.
Way to go, Commander! You really shut up Beau LeChomp!
He's too thick skinned to give up!
Keep going! Tranquility Cove is chomping at the bit to get rid of Beau.
Nice one! Keep this up and Beau will be crying to his mommy to save him.
Excellent! You really swamped LeChomp's forces that time!
Good work! That victory was a real mouthful for LeChomp!
Beau will be slithering back to his bayou shack soon enough.
That defeat should give LeChomp something to chew on...
You're making LeChomp look more like "LeChump" out there!
After that defeat, I'll bet LeChomp is calling Animal Control!
Beau will be retiring back into his stinky swamp with a few more like that!
Even if LeChomp cried "Surrender!" I doubt we'd understand him.
Beau is as thick headed as his little pet here!
Good news! Tranquility Cove is biting back against LeChomp!
Beau really bit the dust on that one!
That's it! You knocked the teeth right out of LeChomp's forces!
Surely Beau is tasting the pain with that big mouth of his!
Great news! Some of the mines have been liberated!
Perhaps Beau and his little pet will make a good addition to our zoo after we defeat him!
Tranquility Cove is almost free of this wretch! One more to go, Commander!
We did it! Tranquility Cove is free from LeChomp's clutches!
You call that a victory? I call it an unexplainable phenomenon.
Beware, Commander: The Eel isn't just slippery, he's also sneaky and slimy.
Next time I'll be two steps ahead of you... and one step behind too.
Good work! The Eel's stealth forces have been totally exposed!
Try that again! Fighting me is like fighting water - an exercise in futility.
Keep going! You've inspired the people of Avaron to revolt!
I know every move you are going to make before you even think it!
When we meet again you won't know what hit you... until you hear my laughter!
Way to go, Commander! You've got The Eel biting his own tail.
Nice shooting! I hope The Eel taught his aerial forces how to swim!
I am like the present you shake but cannot guess the contents.
Excellent! We cut off supplies to The Raven's new fortress!
The secret to beating me again is an unsolvable mystery!
The only mysterious thing about The Eel is why he's so cocky!
Great work! You've got The Eel's forces swimming upstream!
You stole that victory from me. Next battle I will steal it back... with interest.
Good news! You've freed some Avaronians from forced labor!
Next battle I will be like smoke: I will get in your eyes and make you cry.
Don't let up! We're reeling in The Eel's defenses!
I predict your next victory will resemble me - highly elusive!
Bravo, Commander! You're making The Eel squeal!
Great shooting! Looks like The Eel is crawling back into his hole!
You didn't beat me. You beat a doppelganger you didn't even know existed.
Hurray! The people of Avaron are free and Raven's fortress is unfinished.
That last victory was nothing more than a figment of your imagination.
It appears you finally won. But appearances can be deceiving... like me!
You think one loss bothers me? I drink Agent Orange Juice for breakfast!
Way to go! Let's hope the Sergeant gets demoted to Private!
Good news, Commander! You inspired Blister Reef to fight back!
Look out kid, I've got a long memory and a short fuse!
Remember: you can't spell Dan O'Might without D.O.A.!
Looks like the Sergeant's going to have to enlist some new recruits!
Another defeat? No sweat - The Sarge is still large and in charge!
That victory is sure to make the Sergeant blow his top!
Keep it up, Commander! Blister Reef's taken back some of their mines!
Next time I'm gonna make you cry "Aunt... and Uncle!"
Bravo! Thanks to you the Sergeant's demo squad was a dud.
You think you're so clever. My smart bombs are gonna make you look dumb!
Nice shooting! The Sergeant's defenses have been disarmed.
No more Mr. Nice Guy. The Pain Train is pulling into the station!
Next battle you won't even see me coming - I'm a stealth bomber!
Excellent! We captured a Dark Alliance shipment of Blister Reef's ore!
Anything that doesn't kill me just makes me use stronger explosives!
Way to defuse the Sergeant, Commander!
Another cheap win like that and I'm gonna blow your brains out!
Great news! Another couple victories and Sarge is ready to detonate!
Try that again and the last thing you'll hear is me yelling, "Fire in your pie hole!"
We reclaimed Blister Reef's ore and shut down work on Raven's fortress!
Congratulations! That victory deserves the Medal of Honor!
When Raven gets wind of this, watch out! The man's got an explosive temper.
Curse you, kid! That sound you hear isn't thunder - it's my future imploding!
The lucky fool wins but once; the awesome warlord, many times.
I think that victory made Kung Fucius sea sick, Commander!
Kung Fucius say, "He who beats a superior opponent lives on borrowed time."
Beware: Kung Fucius is never more dangerous than when cornered.
Good news! You've inspired Ithmar to take back some power lines!
My defeat? Improbable. Your demise? Inevitable.
That victory was satisfying but I bet you're hungry for another!
It's not the journey - it's the decimation! Way to go, Commander!
To commemorate this defeat, I wrote you a haiku: "Never. Again."
Hurray! We've regained control of part of the power grid!
Kung Fucius say, "There is dignity in defeat, but only when it is your enemy's."
Keep sinking Kung's ships and Davy Jones' locker will be full!
Allow me to offer some free words of wisdom: "Prepare to fail."
Kung Fucius say, "It is hard to spout proverbs when your mouth is full of crow."
Nice work, Commander! You've got the enemy forces totally kung-fused!
Success! The Valkyrie's power is back up to 50%!
Try that again and you will be seeing throwing stars!
Victory! You're turning the lights out on Kung Fucius!
Excellent! You've turned Kung's many black belts... to black and blue!
A good warrior learns from his mistakes. A good warlord avenges them.
That's the spirit! Kung Fucius will soon be helpless and powerless!
Kung Fucius say, "He who relishes victory will eventually choke on defeat."
The bee stings but once; the wasp, many times. To be clear: I am the wasp.
I think you've enlightened Kung Fucius on how dim his forces are!
Don't let up! You're on the brink of winning this power struggle!
Kung Fucius say, "One cannot have harmony without harm."
Step it up, Commander! Dr. Seabolt is counting on you to restore full power!
Experience teaches us humility; defeat, wisdom; revenge, ecstasy.
Kung Fucius say, "Glory is not in never falling, but in killing those who knock us down."
Sweet shooting! Ithmar will be trading candles for electricity in no time!
Fortune is fickle and fleeting - victory visits the violent!
You're making your opponent kung-furious with all these victories!
Keep it up and you'll make Kung Fucius walk the plank on his own ship!
Kung Fucius say, "The Raven will be a vulture when he learns of my demise."
Kung Fucius say, "The journey is the reward... unless it ends in soul-crushing defeat."
Shame on you, darling! Zat is no vay to treat a lady.
Wow! That victory was a real thing of beauty... unlike The Duchess.
All's Fair in Love and War
Bravo, Commander! The Duchess will need a facial after that defeat!
I'm not accustomed to losing. It's very bad feeling... like hair on ze man's back.
I am a duchess! Shooting royalty is zomething of a crime in my country!
Thanks to you, Commander, the Duchess is having a bad hair day!
Good news! We've received a tip that the Duchess is ready to fold!
Ve must do this again soon, darling. But next time... I vill be on top!
I'm sorry but The Duchess puts the "ass" in assassin!
Excellent work, Commander! That's what I call sharp-shooting!
I like a man who is polite enough to let a lady vin sometimes...
My Poppa always zay, "Vere zere is a vill, zere is a kill."
Great shooting, Commander! That victory was a real bulls-eye!
Don't stop now! San Topaz is ready to rally behind you!
After zat defeat, I vill take off ze silencer so you can hear my kill-shot!
Keep it up! Pretty soon The Duchess's hair is going to be all grey!
Ven I see you smile at your victory, my trigger finger itches so badly!
Great news, Commander! San Topaz is following your lead!
How vill I kill you next time? Let me count ze vays....
Look at that! The Duchess's forces are really misfiring now!
I think The Duchess is almost ready to throw in her monogrammed towel!
I was saving it for special occasion, but now you deserve my silver bullet!
Victory! You put San Topaz back in charge of their military!
Only thing vorse zan losing... is telling ze Raven I lose.
Listen to me, Darling. I vill make you an offer now you can't refuse...
One win is only one more than zero - that victory was worth very little!
Don't let up! This snake could crush those Corte Marino hostages!
Viper has two words for your puny victory: HAHA! Or is that one word...?
What a victory! You really took Viper to the house that time!
Next time I will crush you like a bug under my very expensive boot!
Nice shooting, Commander! You defanged some of Viper's forces!
Good work! Viper should use his trust fund to buy a clue.
Nothing can stop Viper in our next battle! I am bigger than the Big Bang!
Take away this guy's steroids and he's as scary as a super model!
Soon I will learn to spell "victory" and you will learn to love defeat!
If this guy's as dumb as he looks he probably can't spell "surrender" either.
You can't conquer me! I am unvincible!
Keep at it, Commander! Viper is starting to unravel!
Viper sheds losses like a snake sheds its skin... but I do not eat my losses.
Well done! That's how you beat Viper - bite him in the asp!
You fight like a baby, Commander! Time to put you in a Viper Diaper!
You can't beat me again! The only me-beater... is me!
Forget speaking with a forked tongue - this snake can barely speak!
No more toying with my prey! Now Viper will swallow you whole!
Super! A few more victories like that and Viper will be hisssstory!
I refuse to lose! Except when I lose. Then refusing is pointless.
After that defeat Viper should just tattoo "loser" on his forehead!
Bold move, you snake. Oh, wait... I am the Viper!
Nice job, Commander! That victory over Viper was cold-blooded!
This is unpossible! I thought the size of my muscles guaranteed victory!?
Look at that, Commander! Some of Viper's forces are slithering away!
Next time you are in striking distance Viper will bite your tank!
Congratulations! You've freed some hostages from Viper's coils!
How do you keep winning?! There must be a secret button I'm not pushing...
Viper should change his name to "Vapor" because he just went up in smoke!
Brilliant! All the hostages are safely back on Corte Marino!
The Raven lied to me! He said I couldn't lose! Or was it "shouldn't"...?
Some say losing builds character. Viper says losing builds losers!
Consider that victory a gift. But do not expect another.
Nice shooting, Commander! Now there's egg all over Raven's face!
Way to go, Commander! You really cracked some heads on Skull Island!
Who says I am cruel? Next battle I will put you out of your misery quickly.
Success! That humbling of Raven is quite a feather in your cap!
Good work! The Raven's forces just got totally plucked!
This is Skull Island! Your monotonous battle plan is making it "Dull Island."
Nice job, Commander! You're making light work of the Dark Alliance!
Next time your tombstone will read: "Here lies the embodiment of failure."
Keep it up, Commander, and Raven will be migrating to prison for winter!
When I think of what I have planned for our next battle, I actually pity you.
Keep at it! We've released some prisoners from Skull Island!
That's the spirit, Commander! Put an end to this birdbrain!
To say you are a waste of my bullets is a colossal understatement...
Well done! The Raven may be my father, but you are his daddy!
Bravo! Soon the Raven will have to wave goodbye to his Sun Storm!
I have nothing but contempt for you. And that is more than you deserve.
Fool! You think my hope has flown? Nevermore!
Excellent work! That's the way to make the Raven eat crow!
I don't know how you do it, Commander - that was poetry in commotion!
You think you actually deserved that victory?! You should just forfeit next time.
Don't let up, Commander! You're turning Raven's forces into chickens!
After that victory, everybody's going to be ravin' about your skills!
From now on the magnitude of my battle prowess will be off the Richter scale!
Hurray! You really brought the Raven back down to Earth!
You play checkers, Commander, while I play chess. Prepare for checkmate!
Great work! The Raven's forces are falling from the sky!
You have two choices: surrender or die. Although I would prefer both!
Brilliant! You freed the last of Raven's prisoners!
Defeating me is a fool's errand, but even you are not so foolish to try!
Do you hear that? That's the sound of enemy forces fleeing in fear!
A few more victories and Raven goes into a maximum security birdcage!
There will be no Cinderella story this time - I will crush your glass slipper!
In the pantheon of great battle commanders, you are at the top!
Be warned: I am planning a huge victory celebration in your honor!
When I was commander of your island I won with infinitely more style!
You think you've won your freedom, but your new empire will be a target for more warlords. Good luck with that...

Congratulations! You can now participate in War Games, which help you train for the enemy attacks to come. You and your friends get rewards when you "invade" and "repel" each other. When you visit friends, you may see and be seen by players with whom you are not friends.
Friendly actions increase your Honor level and earn defensive Power-Ups!
Unfriendly actions raise your Infamy level and earn offensive Power-Ups!
Activate your World Embassy to declare neutrality and make yourself immune to enemy invaders.
Invade your neighbors to gain valuable resources. If you're successful, they'll have a chance to repel your attack.
Help your friends by repelling invaders from their island.
Click on your invasion portrait to collect rewards after a successful invasion.
Activate the World Embassy to prevent invasion from hostile players. By activating it, you will also withdraw from current occupations.
You are unable to activate the World Embassy for another {timeString}.
You have successfully invaded {empirename} and can now collect resources there.
You have successfully repelled the invasion! Attack them back by clicking on their portrait in the Neighbor Bar.

string.original: Hire friends to staff your World Embassy and extend the length of its activation time.
Launching this attack will shut down the World Embassy. Others will be able to attack you. You will not be able to reactivate the World Embassy for {timeString}.
You cannot invade other players so soon after activating your World Embassy. You must wait {timeString} before launching an invasion.
Actions in an invaded area cost extra energy. Click 'Accept' to continue.
Structures in an invaded area can not be moved. Are you sure to continue?
This invasion has already been repelled!
Sorry, you cannot move this object out of an invaded area!
Sorry, you cannot sell this object because it's in an invaded area.
You are defending against another invasion in this empire. Please complete the current defend before starting another.
You are a Crew Member: Visit to gain Rewards!
Sir, I doubt our units will win this battle! Consider deploying these unit types instead:
This Unit is currently fighting in {host}'s Empire! Would you like to continue that battle?
This Unit is currently fighting {host}! Would you like to continue that battle?
This Unit is currently defending your Empire from {host}! Would you like to continue that battle?
Congratulations! You have received this reward! You can find it in your inventory.
Congratulations! You have received these rewards! You can find them in your inventory.
Each of your allies can mine a specific type of ore, which can access through visiting and trading!
Add more neighbors to have greater access to all types of ore!
Evil forces attacked under the cover of darkness. Rebuild before they strike again.
Evil forces launched a sneak attack against our peaceful island. Get ready to fight back!
The homeland is attacked by a mysterious enemy, but {user_name} swiftly fends them off. What is the meaning behind these attacks?
Restore your empire to its former glory!

{empire_name} is founded and the people are rallying behind their new commander. It is soon discovered that the attacks are being orchestrated by a syndicate of cruel warlords called The Dark Alliance which is being led by a mysterious man named The Raven.
Fight The Dark Alliance on their own turf!
{empire_name} builds its first Navy to defeat the warlord, Captain Krunsch. After this victory, it becomes clear that this Dark Alliance leader was sent to steal {rare} from the region.
Keep our secrets out of enemy hands!

{empire_name} builds its first Air Force and liberates Mercadia's military bases from the cunning Kai Tana. Her defeat reveals a possible grand scheme requiring The Raven's warlords to scour the region for all the {rare} they can find.

The arrogant Jada Bombs is caught plundering Reef Haven's oil reserves before {user_name} puts a stop to it. In her hurried retreat, she leaves behind the schematic of a mysterious machine called the "Sun Storm". It's clear now that this is what The Raven must be building. But what is it?
Protect our island's most precious asset!

{user_name} liberates the people of Teramar from their enslaver, Baron Crashalot. He leaves behind information revealing the true purpose of the Sun Storm device: it is a weapon of mass disintegration! The Raven intends to eliminate all those who are not loyal to him.
Beat the Raven to the Big Bang!

{empire_name}'s leading scientist, Dr. Seabolt is captured by The Graves Girls, who have forced him to work on the Sun Storm. Once {user_name} frees Dr. Seabolt from his captors, he pledges to develop a counter weapon to neutralize this weapon of doom.
Shut him down before he blows you up!

Dr. Seabolt reveals that Professor Von Helman is building the Sun Storm at a facility on Lobster Bay. {user_name} defeats Von Helman's forces, thus slowing down The Raven's progress. But The Raven won't abandon his diabolical plan that easily.
Lead the revolt against the Raven's tyranny!

The victory at Lobster Bay reveals that Scarlett led the revolt against the previous tyrannical regime. Meanwhile, Dirk "Digger" Mollman has converted Pacificor's City Hall into a Dark Alliance outpost. After a grueling struggle, Dirk is expelled from Pacificor by the forces of {empire_name}, and he is sent into exile.
Push the Raven back to his island fortress!

As Dr. Seabolt tirelessly researches a counter to the Sun Storm weapon, the Dark Alliance warlord, Nurse Malady, is kidnapping civilians and sending them to a toxic testing facility. {user_name} stops this treacherous plot by defeating her forces and sends her into hiding. The Raven's influence in the region begins to decline.
Steal the Plans to the Raven's fortress!

Dr. Seabolt finishes his design for the counter weapon to The Raven's Sun Storm weapon, calling it "The Valkyrie". Constructing it however, will require the high density ores of Tranquility Cove, which is being guarded by Beau Le Chomp. {user_name} defeats this gator-loving warlord and frees up the metals for the Dr Seabolt's Valkyrie project.
Dig up the Raven's dark secrets!

The Raven's slimy general, The Eel, is forcing the people of Avaron into collecting resources for the Dark Alliance. {user_name} frees the people of Avaron and soundly defeats The Eel on the battlefield. When the dust settles, The Eel reveals the shocking truth that The Raven is the former leader whom Scarlett ousted.
Help Scarlett battle the ghosts of the past!

The Raven has received word about the Valkyrie project and intends to prevent its construction. He sends Sgt. Dan O Might to attack the prototype, but {user_name} stops him in his tracks. In the wake of his retreat, he leaves a controversial photograph revealing that The Raven is Scarlett's father.
Stop the Raven from taking revenge on Scarlett!

Scarlett confesses that The Raven is indeed her father, but that he must be taken down nonetheless. The Valkyrie prototype is ready for testing, but the Dark Alliance's Kung Fucius has hijacked all the power in the region. Final testing of the Valkyrie resumes once {user_name} defeats Kung Fucius and power is restored.
Learn the location of the Raven's island fortress!

The Valkyrie is almost complete. The only remaining question is the location of The Raven's secret fortress. After a humiliating defeat, The Raven's girlfriend, The Duchess, surrenders and reveals the crucial information needed to plan the final assault.
Turn the Raven's last ally against him!

The Raven's personal protege, The Viper, is the last warlord standing between {empire_name} and The Raven himself. But even the man whom the Raven thinks of as the son he never had can't hold up to the military genius of {user_name}.
Put an end to the Raven's reign of terror!

As a final gesture of defiance, The Raven activates his Sun Storm weapon upon {empire_name}. The Valkyrie, however, is also launched and proves to be more effective than imagined. It not only destroys the Sun Storm, but also The Raven's island fortress! The Raven's reign of terror has ended.
Congratulations! You've built a new Empire. Share this with the world and you may receive welcome gifts.
Congratulations! You've drafted your first army. Would you like to celebrate by sending a gift to your friends?

string.original: {user} appears to be preparing for battle by increasing production capacity. This could be trouble.
The honorable {user} is being a good ally by lending a helping hand. It renews my faith in humanity.
No good deed goes unpunished, usually!
All’s fair in love and war. And there’s not much love, as {user} lays siege to an allies island.
{user} is cutting through the Dark Alliance forces and liberating the world of The Raven's tyranny!
{user} defeated Captain Krunsch and is bent on defeating The Raven and his Dark Alliance.
{user} took down the cunning Dark Alliance temptress and revealed a clue about The Raven's plan!
Jada Bombs went down in flames thanks to {user}! Another clue about The Raven's plot has been exposed!
Baron Crashalot is now pushing daisies thanks to {user}! The Raven's evil plot has finally been exposed!
Baron Crashalot hit the ground hard!
{user} crushed the Dark Alliance warlords, the Grave Girls, and freed our Dr. Seabolt from their oppression!
{user} showed Von Helman who the real military strategist is and wiped out the last of his forces.
{user} has the Dark Alliance on the retreat as Dirk "Digger" is sent running for his life.
Dirk "Digger" Mollman has finally dug his own grave!
{user} saved the people of Port Sylvan by defeating their cruel oppressor, Nurse Malady!
Nurse Malady is put to bed!
{user} has safeguarded the precious ore of Tranquility Cove by throwing outtreacherous Beau Le Chomp and his forces.
{user} has freed the people of Avaron from their slavery under the torment of The Eel.
The Eel is captured and interrogated!
{user} has protected the empire's secret weapon prototype by taking out the cunning Dan O Might!
Sgt. Dan O Might is defused!
{user} has restored hope to the empire and soundly defeated Kung Fucius, the Dark Alliance's martial arts master.
Kung Fucius bows to his doom!
The Duchess has surrendered herself to {user, name} in exchange for vital information about The Raven!
string.variation: The Duchess has surrendered herself to {user,fem} in exchange for vital information about The Raven!
The Duchess has surrendered herself to {user,masc} in exchange for vital information about The Raven!

string.original: {user} has forced The Viper to leave The Dark Alliance in shame. Now all remaining is The Raven himself!
{user} has finally defeated The Raven and his evil Dark Alliance!
The Raven's reign of terror is over!
{user} noticed your Civic Building can be finished.

string.original: Did you know Empires & Allies is available in many different languages?
Hello! We're excited to announce that Empires & Allies now supports the following language:
Hello! We're excited to announce that Empires & Allies now supports the following languages:
You can change the language of the game by using the drop-down menu (globe) on the upper right corner of the screen.

The Dark Alliance
Intel: A sinister man they call "The Raven" has recruited warlords from around the world to attack us. We don't know this mastermind's real name, where he is headquartered, or why he picked our island to invade.
We must rebuild and fight back before he strikes again!
Intel: Reports show the warlord called "Captain Krunsch" has raided Cape Pleasants' farms to feed Dark Alliance forces, leaving the citizens without food.
Profile: An old school seaman who relishes taking out his enemies the old-fashioned way: with his bare, arthritic hands.
Caution: Fortified with Vitamin D and Fish Oil
Intel: Captain Krunsch had a note from the Raven under his hat. It read: "Steal their {rare}. It's essential to my plan."
Profile: A cunning temptress with a tongue as sharp as her blade, Kai Tana will cut you up and feed you to the fishes.
Intel: Hidden in Kai Tana's closet was a list of all the metals the Dark Alliance is stockpiling; the only metal they are missing is our {rare}. We think they're up to something.
Profile: Highly skilled in hand-to-hand combat, Jada's entire body is a lethal weapon. Especially when she wears skin-tight pants.
Danger: Do Not Fight While Using Hairdryer!
Intel: Hidden in one of Jada's wigs was the schematic for a mysterious machine called "The Sun Storm". Further analysis is required to understand its purpose.
Profile: As a child Crashalot tried to fly from his rooftop and knocked a few screws loose. But that only partially explains his psychotic behavior.
Caution: His Overhead Bins May Have Shifted During Flight
Intel: In Crashalot's plane was an instruction manual for The Sun Storm: a machine that creates a wave of energy capable of destroying entire islands.
Profile: According to their parents, these terrible twins are identical in every way, right down to the matching "black heart" birthmarks on their backsides.
Warning: May Use Teenage Sarcasm As A Weapon

Intel: The Girls bolted in opposite directions, blaming each other for their miserable defeat. Left behind in their powder room were the keys to the scientists' prison cells. The now freed scientists report that the Raven is on schedule to complete his "Sun Storm" device.
Profile: To compensate for his diminutive size and hideous appearance, Von Helman employs uncommon cruelty and sports fancy glasses.
Danger: Brain Under Pressure! May Explode!
Intel: Inside one of his nicely pressed uniforms, Von Helman had this old newspaper article regarding a previous war in the region...
Profile: As a kleptomaniac child, Dirk tried to steal a toy from a Doberman. He lost an arm but gained a career as a thief specializing in tunneling.
Intel: After his defeat Digger fled the region in fear. His last words were: "If I go back to The Raven I'm just digging my own grave."
Profile: Malady loves to "play doctor" with unsuspecting victims, dispensing generous doses of pain and suffering.

Intel: Inside Malady's medical bag was an assortment of very long needles and a prescription for The Raven's depression brought on by recent battle losses. The Dark Alliance is clearly on their heels.
Profile: This Bayou-born brawler loves his alligator like a son. But he absolutely refuses to do a paternity test.
Warning: Keep Hands And Feet Outside The Gator At All Times
Intel: LeChomp had only two items of value left behind in his swamp shack: his momma's Gumbo recipe and an oath to keep Scarlett from accessing the Metals of Tranquility Cove.
Profile: A real slippery character. His background is such a mystery that no one has ever seen his entire face, although some say he's just hiding bad teeth.
Intel: A troubling excerpt from The Eel's interrogation: "Do you believe in ghosts? You should. Because the former commander of your island is alive... and he is The Raven!"
Profile: While other boys were playing sports, young "Sarge" was playing with fire. And dynamite. And napalm. And nitroglycerin...
Danger! Extinguish Open Flames Before Fighting
Intel: Found in the Sarge's man-purse was a puzzling photo of a young Scarlett under the parental supervision of a commander.
Profile: A master of every martial art known to man, plus a few he invented himself, there is only one art at which Kung Fucius fails: Karaoke.
Caution: Kung's Eyebrows Are Licensed To Kill
Intel: With Kung Fucius eliminated, power has been restored to the region and progress on the Valkyrie Weapon has resumed.
Profile: Currently Raven's girlfriend, but her first love will always be the sniper rifle her father gave her for her 8th birthday.
Intel: The Duchess helped Raven form his empire. She offers to reveal the location of his secret fortress in exchange for sanctuary.
Profile: Puny and picked on as a child, Viper used steroids and a huge trust fund to transform himself into an egomaniac who could pick on the world.
Intel: Viper left this letter behind: "The Raven talked me into spending all of my own trust fund money to pay for this whole war. If you defeat him, can you get some of my money back?"
Profile: Feared by his allies, hated by his enemies, The Raven is an unapologetic tyrant who wanted his pet mascot to be an eagle, but he couldn't catch one.
Intel: Millions of dollars in Raven's offshore bank account were just withdrawn by Viper for the purpose of "building my own empire."
His Excellency the President for Life

string.original: By providing us with these permissions, we will help you and your friends connect and provide you the latest news about the game.
Why Does Empires & Allies ask me for information?
Our primary use of your basic information, such as your name and photo, as well as your friends list is to enable you to see and play with your friends in our game.

We use your email address to send you alerts on things like gifts, neighbor invitations and occasionally info on new features, games and special offers, including free virtual cash. You can change your preferences at any time.
We provide fun ways for you to share posts and rewards with friends on Facebook. We don't post without your permission.
We need to know your birthday to ensure you receive age-appropriate content.
You have {amount} Friends that are playing Empires & Allies, why not join the fun?
Check out our Privacy Policy for more information.

These VTOL Engines are just what we needed!
Ask your friends for Flight Helmets to buy upgrades.
Send your friends Flight Helmets and you may get some in return.
Now we can buy more upgrades for the Air Force!
Collect Smart Bombs from your friends.
Be a good neighbor and send your friends some Smart Bombs of their own.
Use the Smart Bombs to purchase upgrades for your Air Force.
Collect Drop Tanks to help improve our air force.
Gift some Drop Tanks - you never know what you'll get in return.
These new Drop Tanks will improve our aircraft!
Click on enemy units to begin battle.
Objects can be moved around the map.
Click on Edit and select the move cursor to move items on the map.
Now you can change the look of your island.
Allies can turn the tide of battle. You must learn to use them.
Your allies can make the difference between defeat and victory.
I just won a battle in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first army in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first navy in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first air force in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just defeated a villain in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
Hello friend! Come be my neighbor in Empires and Allies and together we can build empires and defeat our enemies.
Hello friend! Come be my ally in Empires & Allies and together we can build empires and defeat our enemies.
Click here! Head on over to Empires & Allies!
I need {partName,object,plural} for my unit upgrades. Can you help me out?
string.variation: I need {partName,plural} for my unit upgrades. Can you help me out?

Do you have more pending neighbor request to accept?

string.variation: {user,fem} is under attack! This must not stand! Help them to repel the invading force of {invader}!
{user,masc} is under attack! This must not stand! Help them to repel the invading force of {invader}!

string.original: Hey! Can you help me out by sending me {item}?
Send a request to get some help!
If you don't see a friend in the list, it is because you already asked him/her for a gift today
If the list below is blank, it's because you can only send each friend only one neighbor request per day.
Invite your friends to join you in battle!
You're looking good out there, Commander. But we've still got a lot of work ahead of us. Let's start with building more Cannon Artillery.
Krunsch has a naval blockade protecting his final island, we need to build our own Navy and hit them head on.
I bet you wanna start dropping those enemy Soldiers faster. The Vintage Tank is just the thing to do that.
The boys at the lab need more {rare} to get ahead on their research. You know what to do.
The enemy has stationed a blockade to prevent supplies from traveling between some of our islands. The fools!
I just got a head's up from Scarlett that we have some big battles ahead of us. Those allies or ours might come in handy right about now.
Our boys have managed to capture a Dark Alliance submarine, but need to get it back to our island.
Intel from that sub we captured revealed that one of our farms is hiding weapons for The Dark Alliance. Check it out.
One of our recon drones has been shot down. We gotta find it before the enemy finds it.
One of our most highly decorated pilots is retiring. He deserves a regal welcome!
We have intel that a black market arms dealer is selling weapons to The Raven. Let's shut him down.
We need to detain and interrogate this arms dealer before The Raven catches on.
We can catch the illicit arms supplier if we just pose as a buyer on the market.
Hey Boss! Name's McCann, but you can call me Mac. Let's start rebuilding the empire.
People need somewhere to live. Let's build some houses.
We'll need Oil to construct more advanced units. Let's rebuild our Oil production facilities.
We just got a tip that there's going to be some market shortages heading our way. Let's stock up to be safe.
We're gonna need a lot more wood to continue building structures. How about we set up a Lumber Mill?
It's Scarlett's birthday and I wanted to surprise her with a Strawberry pie. Whaddaya say, boss?
We'd better start building up our infrastructure if we want to take on the Dark Alliance. Let's start with getting some more wood.
Scarlett is right on the money about those Ore Mines. Let's get some up and running NOW!
We can only mine {rare} on our island, so we'll need to trade with our allies to get other types of ore.
Our allies are offering a surplus of {nrare3}. We should go visit them and take it off their hands!
Our allies' production has been slowed by a natural disaster. Let's help them out.
My kids are working on a science fair project for school. Mind if we help them out with some raw materials?
Just got word that there's a surge of {nrare2} in the market. We gotta grab it all up before The Raven does.
The guys wanna have a log carving contest this weekend, but we're missing one important part: some good logs!
Our allies have Ore surpluses they're willing to donate. I say we get in on the action before they change their minds!
Market experts are predicting a shortage of {nrare4}. Let's see if our neighbors wouldn't mind sparing some.
I've heard there might be some good sales at the Market.
The boys want to have a pumpkin launching event this weekend. Whaddaya say, boss? Want to chunk some pumpkins?
Okay Boss, if we're buildin' an air force we need a helluva lot more {rare}.
Head's up, Boss! If you want more ships we're gonna need more {rare} than we can mine on our island. You can lean on your neighbors for the other four ore types.
If you ask me, Boss, there's somethin' familiar about this putz. Must be the rubber gloves...
I'm with Scarlett on this one, Boss. We're in a good ol' fashioned arms race with the Raven. So excuse the pun, but let's put the pedal to the metal and get some ore!
Want my advice, Boss? Let Scarlett figure out why the Raven hired our old Defense Advisor. You and me, we got a keep focused on advancing our empire.
Case you never heard, it was Scarlett who ousted our last commander. I'm sure she had her reasons for not offin' him when she had the chance...
I don't know how they got a copy of our map, but if we don't find the rest of it, those goons will build a bomb and blow us to smithereens!
We got a problem, Boss. My boys in engineerin' say our dog won't hunt -- The Valkyrie Weapon still can't get enough power and we're running out of time!
Great news, Boss! My boys in engineerin' have the Valkyrie Weapon powered up!. The only problem is we now have to wait until the Sun Storm is actually used on us!
Whoa, I had no idea. One thing's for sure. If we ever take down this Raven, we gotta make sure he never comes back!
This is the moment we've all been waitin' for -- The Valkyrie is ready to rock! Let's just hope this thing works! Cross your fingers!
Our population is reaching capacity! We should build a Government Building so we can support more houses.
You have the full support of the people Commander, collect rent from them to help fund your empire.
The officers would like to reward the troops' hard work with a shipment of Watermelons.
We are holding a picnic to help the people and raise money for the war.
People are flocking to our island to escape the oppression of the Dark Alliance.
With our population growing now, the people could really use a bigger park to enjoy with their families.
Some of our vets returning home don't have a place to live.
Our citizens have been flocking to the theater for an escape from the war. So much that they've run out of popcorn!
Commander, the people are proud to have you as their leader. Place a flag down to let them know you're here to stay.
Commander, the people are proud to have you as their leader. Place a flag down to let them know you're here to stay.
The more allies we have, the more successful we'll be - for both combat missions as well as domestic operations.
Job well done in getting our economy back on its feet, sir. Now all we need is a Treasury Building for our future growth.
Sir, we have reports that some of the neighboring islands are low on {rare}. Let's put our Market to good use.
The people have asked that we build a park as a place for solace during these turbulent times.
Survivors from the other islands need homes. Maybe we can spare some cottages.
We've just received word that some of our scientists are stranded on one of the liberated islands. We must rescue them before they fall into enemy hands.
The council has approved the construction of a Maritime Academy so we can attract more hopeful cadets to our island.
One of our liberated islands is the home of an endangered species of sea turtle. It's not too late to save them!
Diplomats need a place to stay when they visit our island. Let's build them an Executive Mansion!
Families are worried about their loved ones on the front lines. Let's place some mailboxes around our city to put their worries to rest.
Visitors from other islands are running out of places to stay. Let's show them some hospitality!
Our cereal shipment was lost at sea. It's not too late to harvest some more Wheat of our own.
Ever since the new daylight saving hours began, our people have been walking the streets in the dark. Let's provide some light for them.
There's a pigeon lady lobbying for us to build a Park Gazebo. What do you say, sir?
Citizens that you liberated from Dark Alliance oppression are asking for asylum until they get back on their feet again.
We cannot forget what has happened recently, sir. We need to preserve our history during this time.
As our population grows, we have to stay ahead and think about the future.
As our population grows, we need to make sure our communities stay safe.
As our population grows, we need to make sure our citizens stay informed.
As our population grows, we need to make sure the enemy doesn't try to infiltrate our communities.
We're hosting a reception for the leaders of the other islands - just in time for me to try out my new pineapple salsa recipe!
We've discovered another species endangered due to The Raven's tyranny. We can still relocate them if we hurry.
The people want to show their appreciation for those who have fallen for the empire.
The Dark Alliance has a blockade on one of our recently liberated islands. They need our help.
The blockaded island is thankful and wants to return the favor with {nrare3}. They just need an escort.
We've managed to negotiate the release of some hostages. We should prepare some meals for our hungry friends.
The rescued hostages have arrives but we have no housing for them.
Your victories are attracting more tourists to our island. A Rose Garden would be a great addition to our government quarter.
The farmer's market vendors have all run out of Sunflowers for this weekend.
Adding a Maze Garden could be a great addition for kids to enjoy our parks.
We are hosting a celebratory cocktail hour for visiting dignitaries, but we're all out of fruit!
The people are putting together a celebratory dinner in honor of your victories on the battlefield.
We're going to build a corn maze to give the children something fun to do.
Our beautiful island! How could this happen? Commander, it's time to rebuild!
Here's some information we've pulled together from the wreckage of that Tank.
More enemy forces are on the way! Click on the Battle Map when you are ready to fight them.
This feels like the calm before the storm. I'm afraid trouble's brewing.
Enemy troops are invading the North Island!
Use the barracks to train new soldiers.
I've called in your Domestic Advisor to launch the rebuilding effort.
I just heard Commander Steele survived the attack. He might make a powerful ally.
We've got to help the people of Cape Pleasant!
He's reeling from that one! Let's keep on him!
Looks like we've got ourselves back on our feet. Sergeant Cross will be helping you train and build up your forces. He's the best there is!
Captain Krunsch has fled, but we should build up our infrastructure before we go after him.
Click on Return Home when you're ready to leave Steele's island.
Commander, Cape Pleasant needs our help! Until I can scare up more intel, work with Mr. McCann, your Domestic Advisor, to prepare for war.
There are more survivors out there who can join our cause.
Here's our battle plan, Commander: Every nation we liberate from the Dark Alliance earns us an ally and pushes back The Raven. Any questions?
That was close, Commander. Kai Tana used her forces as a diversion to try to steal our ore map. Luckily, her cheap perfume gave her away.
Commander, until we know why the enemy wants our {rare} we must defend our perimeter against security breaches. My advice is to build more ships and be prepared for anything.
Not to put pressure on you, Commander, but we are the last bastion of hope. Because if the Raven builds his Sun Storm before we do, the entire world is in danger.
Mac's instinct was correct. Von Helman used to be our Defense Advisor but under a different name-- he had my job!
Full disclosure, Commander: I led the revolt on our previous leader. Trust me, he got what he deserved. I can explain later.
In exchange for surrender we offered Digger sanctuary. He didn't feel, however, we had enough single women for a man of his... means.
We just intercepted a transmission from The Raven to Malady. He was furious his "package" from her had not arrived.
One more battle, Commander! Then we can feed this creepy Cajun to his inappropriate pet.
Commander, if we can defeat this slithery slimeball, we might be able to gain some valuable intel on The Raven's fortress.
I refuse to believe The Raven is our previous commander. The Eel is lying -- he must be. I'll get to the bottom of this if it's the last thing I do...
I have a confession to make, Commander, and I hope you won't think less of me, but... The Raven was my father.
You saw it in Sarge's picture - my father was a good man. But power corrupted him, and I had to stop him before he corrupted our island.
New intel says The Raven's down to his last two warlords. Let's upgrade our military and show him the meaning of "shock and awe."
This is what we've been waiting for, Commander. Only one more victory stands between us and The Raven.
Now it all makes sense -- The Raven used Viper's trust fund to finance his evil empire. I must say, those two were made for each other.
Now The Raven will pay for all that he's done to our peaceful people.
If this all goes as planned, The Raven should serve the rest of his life behind bars. That way he can then live to see how happy the world is without him.
You did it Commander! The Raven's Dark Alliance is but rubble under the sea. Let's hope peace prevails this time.
Captain Krunsch has just taken the neighboring island of Cape Pleasant and is plundering its Ore reserves.
Listen up, you gutless trout! When you lose this battle, I'm going to rip off your ears and use 'em as fishin' chum.
Your next lesson for today, Commander, is humility. I hope you're ready, because I have a lot to show you.
Honey, you are so far outta your league you're gonna need a space shuttle to get home!
I will shoot you! I will bomb you! I will...uh, did I already say I will shoot you?
Everybody says we were born bad, but that is like, so not true. The Graves Girls were born bad-ass.
Don't be such a downer! Join the Dark Alliance and fight with us. 'Cuz the only thing cooler than a twosome... is a threesome!
How pathetic! Your entire battle plan is based on luck. Now you shall feel the wrath of my merciless brilliance.
You fool! I let you win that fight to give you false confidence. After I annihilate your army, I will send a full critique of your hopeless battle strategy.
Geez, after what Raven did to Tina for letting her sister get caught... maybe I shoulda been a dentist like Mother wanted.
Not feeling well after that last battle? Nurse Malady says take two cyanide pills and call me in the morning.
Eva seen a gator drool? I promised Lil' Chomper I'd fix him up a big ol' pot a 'Commander Jambalaya' soon as we fry yer bacon.
Don't look now, but that shadow following you, that's me. Ha!
I'm gonna blow your mind, kid: you don't know Scarlett like you think you do.
Kung Fucius say "He who fights hard will still die most painfully when I finish them."
How shall I destroy you: Broken neck? Punctured spleen? My nunchucks up your nose?
Tell me darling - should I aim for your head... or your heart? Eizer vay, I cannot vait to get you in my crosshairs.
How dare you embarass me! After I terminate you, my very expensive lawyer will sue you for... some big word I cannot spell.
Thank you for making it this far, Commander. Now I can watch you suffer at the hands of my protege. He is the child I always wished Scarlett was.
First I will humiliate you Commander, then I will punish Scarlett for her treachery. And when I say punish, I do not mean spank.
When your island is under my command, you'll all realize what a monumental mistake Scarlett made not killing me when she had the chance.
Our scientists are in a lab facility on Port Sylvan. We'll need to evacuate them before The Dark Alliance discovers their location.
The scientists were working on creating a defensive weapon using {rare}, but had to leave it in the evacuation. We'll need to obtain a new supply.
The investment needed to make our counter-weapon is going to be huge. We'll need to get our currency going again.
We're making good progress working the {rare}, but we're going to need more engineers and scientists.
There's a stash of {rare} on Tranquility Cove, but we'll need a way to smuggle it past the Dark Alliance Blockade.
Some {rare} has appeared on the open market. Buy it before The Raven gets his hands on it.
Commander, I'm Sarah, your Civic Advisor. Let's start earning Coins by building Farms and harvesting crops.
Why was that old scab sent to steal our ore? We'd better get started on some ore mining to be on the safe side.
I don't know who Kai Tana thinks she is, but you can count on things only getting tougher. You will need to diversify your forces and build an Air Force.
We've just received news that the warlord Kai Tana has commandeered Mercadia's military bases. We'll be next if we don't put a stop to this now.
Commander, until we know why the enemy wants our {rare} we have to be on guard. They could be coming back for more.
We're gonna run out of room pretty soon, boss. We should start expanding our borders.
Our allies are in need of {rare}, and we always could use more Coins. Let's build a Market and start trading!
Sir, we have reports that "Jada Bombs" is ransacking Reef Haven's oil reserves for The Dark Alliance. We have to stop her!
Commander, it's not clear how this "Sun Storm" connects to the metals yet. Let's keep an eye out for the Dark Alliance's next move.
I can tell you right now you wanna get ahead of these Dark Alliance forces. Your best bet is to upgrade your units at the Research Lab.
Congratulations commander. It looks like you've finally outgrown your barracks. The big boys get their toys from the Barracks II.
The Dark Alliance's "Baron Crashalot" has forced the population of Teramar to work in their ore mines. We must overthrow him and free our people!

Commander, this Sun Storm weapon will decimate our population if it's ever activated. We need to find a way to defend ourselves from it. Our chief scientist, Dr. Seabolt on Isla Azul might have an answer.
I heard we're heading over to Pacificor. You think you can handle a Shipyard II?
This is terrible. "The Graves Girls" have already taken control of Isla Azul and have captured Dr. Seabolt! They've been forcing him to help build The Raven's Sun Storm weapon.
Commander, I'm Dr. Seabolt. Thank you for rescuing me! However, I have important news for you and Scarlett. There is an early staging facility for the Sun Storm located in Lobster Bay.
A staging facility? An assault there should slow down the weapon's development. It won't be easy, though. The Raven's strategist, Von Helman has his forces guarding that region.
Good to see you have an Army Research Lab. I can tell you one thing, that's not going to be enough to confront Von Helman. You should also build an Air Force Research Lab.
"Von Helman"? Hm, something smells awfully fishy about this. Let's not take any chances. Get our Hangar II up so we can get the best aircraft available.
I know a sloppy formation when I see one. That "Von Helman" was our old Defense Advisor! The traitor!
I'm afraid he's right. Von Helman used to be our empire's General -- he had my job!
Hey boss, we can build the new Lumber Mill IIs now. We should give them a try.
Full disclosure, Commander: I led the revolt against our previous leader. Trust me, he got what he deserved. I can explain later.
I see you have your research labs up and working. We'll need a good working research lab to study this Sun Storm weapon. Let's test yours out by upgrading some units.
Sir, we just got news that the warlord "Dirk Digger" has ransacked Pacificor's City Hall and turned it into a Dark Alliance outpost.
We better trim the slack around here. Time to upgrade our forces!
I'm encouraged, Commander. Digger's retreat is a sign of weakness from The Dark Alliance. We've definitely got their attention now.
Sir, we've just got word that the warlord "Nurse Malady" has been kidnapping our people and sending them to a toxic testing facility at Port Sylvan!
Sir, I've just received word about the kidnappings. We should check in with our neighbors to make sure everyone's still accounted for.
Commander, we finally have a solid design of a counter weapon to defeat the Sun Storm. I'm calling it the "Valkyrie."
This is great news doctor! How can we help you build it?
We're going to need lots of Ore!
Tranquility Cove is an area rich in high density metals. The only problem is the warlord "Beau LeChomp" is occupying this region and is guarding this important resource.
Nice job liberating Tranquility Cove! Dr. Seabolt's team is off to a great start now. However, I'm sorry to report the people of Avaron have gone missing...
If Scarlett's right, we'll need better soldiers. First you'll need to build a Barracks III.
The Mechanized Soldiers have discovered Kung Fucius' location. He's disrupting the power supply to Ithmar, and the Valkyrie Project.
I refuse to believe The Raven is our previous commander. The Eel is lying -- he must be. I'll get to the bottom of this...
But we have more important matters right now. "Sgt. Dan O'Might" is en route to attack our Valkyrie Weapon prototype. We need to intercept him at Blister Reef.

You saw it in Sarge's picture. It's true. The Raven is my father. He was a good man, once. But power corrupted him, and I had to stop him before he corrupted our island. And now we have to stop him again.
Sir, for some reason we've lost all power to our Valkyrie testing faciltiy. Progress has stopped until we figure out what's going on.
I don't like the reports I'm getting. We need to increase air patrols around the island. Let's build a Hangar III!
The Raptors have discovered advanced scouts sent by The Duchess. Let's shut her down!
The doc has started testing of the Valkyrie Weapon. However, our spies have just informed us that the Sun Storm is also in its final stages of completion. We need to accelerate our production.
Scarlett ain't kiddin, boss. We need to step it up. Let's get that new Lumber Mill III up and running!
If what Scarlett said is true, we'll need all the help we can get to speed things up.

We're getting down to the final hour and we still don't know the exact location of The Raven's fortress. We have reports that his warlord girlfriend "The Duchess" will likely surrender if beaten. Perhaps she could help us.
The war is really heating up. We need to expand our production capability.
Scarlett knows what she's doing. Let's stock up on units. It's time we break the seal on those new Oil Well IIIs.
Commander, even though this war isn't over, the people have come together and want to create a park in your honor.
The Dark Alliance is getting desperate. The Viper has taken hostages from Corte Marino in case this next battle doesn't go well for him.
Now it all makes sense -- The Raven used Viper's trust fund to finance his evil empire. I must say, those two are made for each other.
This is it, Boss. The final showdown. Whaddaya say we crack open an Ore Mine III?
Sir, the people are getting restless. They're scared of this doomsday Sun Storm weapon. They could use a little attention from their leader right now.
I've checked with all of our military leaders, commander. They're ready to begin the final push.
Carriers are the best solution to taking down Battleships.
Bombers have a natural enemy in the air: Airships.
Our contacts have spotted some Artillery on its way. Let's train some Grunts to hit them head on.
They keep bringing Tanks to the battle? Just bring some Battleships with you next time.
It's about time we go on a few bombing raids. Whattaya say, Commander?
Listen up. We've just spotted some enemy Carriers. We need to sink them before they become a threat.
They're ratcheting up their tank weapons out there. Let's match them with some big guns of our own!
Those Airships out there need to be rounded up before they cause any more trouble!
The enemy Battleships have been doing some serious damage out there. Let loose our Light Carriers on them.
We just got word that they're sending in Carriers. Let's get our Tanks ready.
Time for some more tank killing, Commander! You up for a hunt?
Gunboats have been intercepting our supply shipments. Our Light Battleships should be able to stop the raids.
The enemy has a hot shot pilot out there shooting down our Allies' Airships. Hunt him down with our Flying Fortress Bombers.
Airships have been raiding our civilian port cities. We need to respond ASAP.
Artillery is en route to bombard our weapons stockpiles. We need to intercept them.
An enemy spy is expecting to be picked up by some offshore Bombers. Sneak up on the Bombers and take out his transportation.
We need to transport an important dignitary back to his home island. Use the Chinook Airships to take out any Tanks that get in our way.
Enemy Artillery is pounding our Battleships from afar. Send out our Assault Carriers to put them down.
Bombers have been targeting our Allies' Farms, leaving their people hungry. Let's put an end to this!
The enemy has a Soldier squad sneaking around our flank. Send the Bombers in to flush them out.
Their Tanks are roaming through our Allies like an angry bull at a Texas rodeo. We've got to slow them down.
There's a squad of enemy Soldiers who have stolen documents in their possession. Send the Sherman's out and hunt them down!
Artillery units are shelling an important Ally's Parliament building. They've abandoned their capital until we can put a stop to it.
We're getting intel of a Bomber squadron en route to Reef Haven. Stop them with my favorite Airship, the Apache!
It's about to start raining Artillery shells if we don't take out those enemy Artillery units.
Their Carrier escort is out of position. Let's sneak in and give them a formal introduction to our Seawolf Gunboats.
We're going Supersonic, Commander! Let's test out these new Bombers with a quick strike!
The enemy has been positioning Airships over a small island holding the population hostage. Send out some Heavy Carriers to see what's going on.
Enemy Carriers are destroying our Ally's Artillery like it's a stroll in the park. Send in the Raptor Fighters ASAP!
I've had just about enough of these Battleships ripping apart our Tank battalions! Mind dropping a Heavy Artillery barrage on them?
Now it's our turn! Build Strike Battleships and hunt down their Tanks to show them what we're capable of.
This Abrams Tank is our best yet. Let's not waste any time and have it do what it does best: shoot down some Fighters!
Enemy Carriers are making their way towards Isla Azul. Head them off with Hunter Killer Gunboats before they get too close.
It's a new age, Commander: The age of the Mechanized Soldier. Let these bad boys loose on the enemy's Artillery for some real fireworks.
The Supercarriers are finally here! Just watch what these things do to Battleships!
The enemy's Bombers are laying down some serious waste to our coastline. Lucky for us, Rocket Artillery was designed just for that.
They're using Gunboats as a blockade to prevent transportation of the wounded. Let's sneak up on them with some Comanche Airships!
They're using a Tank Batallion to guard some hostages. We'll need something real clean to take them out. I'm thinking Railgun Battleships.
Battleships are making a mockery of our Gunboats out there, Commander. Let's give them a little surprise.
A squad of enemy Soldiers are trying to sneak past our front lines. Let's "crush" them with my new favorite Tank...
Our beautiful island! Destroyed! Commander, you must lead us back to glory!
The enemy never sleeps, so let's keep rebuilding. Look for new Tasks on the left.
More enemy forces have landed along the coast! We must fight back!
General Scarlett, reporting for duty. Commander, we're under attack again!
An enemy tank has been discovered in the forest. Hunt it down!
We just spotted another incoming attack!
The more resource buildings we have, the more resources we can pull in!
We can't be pussyfooting it right now. Let's get more Military buildings up so we can build more units!
No reason to not grab all we can. Let's open some more supply lines!
We can't let the enemy get ahead of us. Let's open up some more production lines.
It's that time again, Boss! Let's invest in some more resource supply lines to keep things runnin' smooth.
More Military Buildings, more units on the battlefield. It's that simple.
Our allies are suffering from some major losses. Let's send over some weapons to help them out.
We've received reports of enemies in the area. Scan the perimeter to confirm.
The new Small Stilt Houses can house even more people than Small Island Huts!
Refugees from nearby islands have arrived and are looking for shelter.
Choose the location of your invasion.
I have decided to join your crew!
We should show our solidarity with the people of Cape Pleasant in our struggle against the Dark Alliance.
The people of Cape Pleasant were secretly developing the Dragon Boat to fight the Dark Alliance. To show their gratitude for your help, they are now sharing the plans with you!
Click to start or extend Neutrality

These seeds will grow into corn
